intro: Dichrotrichum clarkei, commonly known as the Clarke's dichrotrichum, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its fine, hair-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
